definitions.definition: A character or part played by a performer or actor .
examples: My neighbor was the lead role in last year's village play.
Her dream was to get a role in a Hollywood movie, no matter how small.

definitions.definition: The expected behaviour of an individual in a society .
examples: The role of women has changed significantly in the last century.

definitions.definition: The function or position of something.
examples: Local volunteers played an important role in cleaning the beach after the oil spill.
What role does the wax in your earhole fulfill?

definitions.definition: Designation that denotes an associated set of responsibilities , knowledge , skills , or privileges
examples: The project manager role is responsible for ensuring that everyone on the team knows and executes his or her assigned tasks.

definitions.definition: ( grammar ) The function of a word in a phrase .
( object-oriented programming ) In the Raku programming language, a code element akin to an interface , used for composition of classes without adding to their inheritance chain.

main_definition: A character or part played by a performer or actor .
secondary_definitions: The expected behaviour of an individual in a society .
The function or position of something.
Designation that denotes an associated set of responsibilities , knowledge , skills , or privileges
( grammar ) The function of a word in a phrase .
( object-oriented programming ) In the Raku programming language, a code element akin to an interface , used for composition of classes without adding to their inheritance chain.

definitions.definition: An ancient unit of quantity, 72 sheets of parchment .

main_definition: ( historical ) An ancient unit of quantity, 72 sheets of parchment .
